ja71:1.1: A lazy pupil takes a nap while others are gathering firewood. At the last moment, he carelessly snaps off a green branch of the Warding Tree, hurting his eye in the process, and ruining the fire.
ja71:1.3: The _varaṇa_ or _varuṇa_ tree is _Crateva religiosa_, popularly known as the sacred garlic pear or temple plant. In Vedic ritual it is associated with rites of the dead and with medicine, in both cases due to its supposed “warding” character, from its root _var_.
